Pre-Game Insights: Delray Rawlins is not intimidated by facing Canada.
Rawlins acknowledged that facing Canada is a tricky assignment but the captain is fearless.
Rawlins emphasized that T20 cricket presents every team with a chance to succeed.
Rawlins said he's not worried at all about facing Canada.
Rawlins believes that anyone can win in T20 cricket if they have a good day out.
Rawlins feels that Bermuda has a lot of players who can go out and get big runs or take down teams.
Rawlins thinks that Bermuda is in the right space to come out on top.
Rawlins was happy to play Canada first up.
Rawlins believes that knowledge of the conditions is not all that Bermuda is counting on for this tournament.
Rawlins said that they can't really dwell on conditions too much because they all know what to expect.
Rawlins believes that everyone's looking forward to the tournament, the preparation's been good, it's been thorough, it's been precise, and they're looking forward to it.
Rawlins made a plea to the fans to give the players the extra motivation they need to qualify for the World Cup.
Rawlins said that the fans' support will give the players a big push and qualify in front of their home fans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bermuda have never been to a T20 World Cup and the existing crop of players have been presented with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to write their names in the island’s history books.
The captain made a plea to the fans to give the players the extra motivation they need to qualify for the World Cup.
Rawlins believes that things have been put in place for a reason — us winning the bid to have it here, it all makes sense.
Others: The article discusses the upcoming T20 World Cup Americas Regional Qualifier match between Bermuda and Canada.
The Canadians are ranked nineteenth while Bermuda are farther down in 32nd place.
Canada arrived on the island from a camp in the United States a day earlier than Cayman Islands and Panama, which meant they got an extra training session on Thursday.
All teams got to fine-tune for the last time yesterday before the action commences today.
